description: Auto-lint files after Claude Code edits - Generated by hooks-setup skill

hooks.comment: Replace LINT_COMMAND_HERE with your language-specific linting command

_examples.javascript_typescript: if [[ "$CLAUDE_TOOL_FILE_PATH" == *.js || "$CLAUDE_TOOL_FILE_PATH" == *.ts || "$CLAUDE_TOOL_FILE_PATH" == *.jsx || "$CLAUDE_TOOL_FILE_PATH" == *.tsx ]]; then npx eslint "$CLAUDE_TOOL_FILE_PATH" --fix 2>/dev/null || true; fi
_examples.python_ruff: if [[ "$CLAUDE_TOOL_FILE_PATH" == *.py ]]; then ruff check --fix "$CLAUDE_TOOL_FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null || true; fi
_examples.multi_language: if [[ "$CLAUDE_TOOL_FILE_PATH" == *.ts || "$CLAUDE_TOOL_FILE_PATH" == *.tsx ]]; then npx eslint "$CLAUDE_TOOL_FILE_PATH" --fix 2>/dev/null || true; elif [[ "$CLAUDE_TOOL_FILE_PATH" == *.py ]]; then black "$CLAUDE_TOOL_FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null || true; fi

_instructions.usage: 1. Choose the appropriate command from _examples above. 2. Replace LINT_COMMAND_HERE with your chosen command. 3. Remove _examples and _instructions objects. 4. Save to .claude/settings.json
notes: Always use '2>/dev/null || true' at the end for graceful failure
Quote $CLAUDE_TOOL_FILE_PATH to handle paths with spaces
Use pnpm exec instead of npx if using pnpm
Test your command manually before deploying
